title: Vegetable Vendor Exposes Mumbai Jeweller's Rs 13.5 Crore Ponzi Scheme - News18
summary:
Vegetable Vendor Exposes Mumbai Jeweller's Rs 13.5 Crore Ponzi Scheme

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: News18

A jeweller in Mumbai has been exposed for running a Ponzi scheme that defrauded investors of over Rs 13.48 crore. The operation was uncovered by a local vegetable seller who lodged a police complaint against the jeweller.

  • The jeweller promised high returns, up to 520% on investments in moissanite.
  • Payments to investors ceased abruptly after initial returns were made.
  • Thousands of investors gathered outside Torres Jewellers’ Dadar office demanding their money back.
  • The police have filed an FIR against the company's directors for fraud.
"The fraud occurred between June 21, 2024, and December 30, 2024. After that, all payments stopped." - Pradeep Kumar Vaishya, Complainant

The investigation is ongoing, with authorities attempting to locate the company's owner, who may have fled abroad.
newTitle: Vegetable Vendor Exposes Mumbai Jeweller's Rs 13.5 Crore Ponzi Scheme

title: Woman Alleges Assault By Kuki "Tenants" Over Land, Naga Village Authority In Manipur Sends Warning - NDTV
summary:
Woman Alleges Assault By Kuki "Tenants" Over Land, Naga Village Authority In Manipur Sends Warning

Publication Date: January 25, 2025

Source: NDTV

A village authority in Manipur has condemned an alleged attack by Kuki tribesmen on a woman who was attempting to build a house on disputed land, highlighting escalating tensions between the Naga and Kuki communities.

  • The Konsakhul Village Authority has given a 15-day ultimatum for the Kuki tenants to vacate the land claimed by the Naga villagers.
  • A woman was reportedly assaulted by 30 men from the Kuki tribes while trying to build a home, prompting civil society organizations to intervene.
  • Video evidence emerged showing aggressive behavior towards the Naga villagers by Kuki individuals.
  • Indigenous People's Forum has demanded immediate action for the safety of Naga villagers, launching a blockade at a key thoroughfare.
  • This incident comes amid growing tensions and previous allegations of violence involving Kuki volunteers against Naga tribes in the region.
“I am the person who was assaulted... The Kukis said I can't build a house there. Some 10-20 of them came, attacked me.” - The woman who was allegedly assaulted.

This incident highlights the ongoing land disputes and ethnic tensions in Manipur, necessitating urgent dialogue and resolution to prevent further violence.
newTitle: Woman Alleges Assault by Kuki Tribes Over Land Dispute in Manipur

title: "Judging Can Be A Lonely Task": Ex-Chief Justice DY Chandrachud To NDTV - NDTV
summary:
Judging Can Be A Lonely Task: Ex-Chief Justice DY Chandrachud To NDTV

Publication Date: New Delhi

Justice DY Chandrachud reflects on his extensive career as the former Chief Justice of India, covering his legal journey, landmark judgments, and personal anecdotes in a recent interview with NDTV.

  • Chandrachud practiced law for nearly 30 years and was the longest-serving Chief Justice of India.
  • He discussed notable judgments on electoral bonds, Article 370, and same-sex marriage.
  • The former Chief Justice emphasized the loneliness of judging, where reflection occurs after arguments are completed.
  • He recalled how he initially desired to pursue economics, influenced by his father's support for his career choices.
  • Chandrachud mentioned the significance of humility in the judiciary, particularly within the Supreme Court.
  • He discussed the need for the Supreme Court to revisit past judgments based on evolving societal context, including overruling some of his father's decisions.
  • The impact of social media criticism on judges' work was highlighted, stressing the importance of context in court discussions.
“Law was not my first choice, to be very honest.” - Justice DY Chandrachud

The interview showcases Justice Chandrachud's reflections on the evolving nature of law, the principle of humility in judgment, and the consideration of social media's impact on public perception of the judiciary.
newTitle: Insights from Ex-Chief Justice DY Chandrachud on Law, Judging, and Society

title: Pune: Doctor Dies In Horrific Road Accident In Undri; Truck Driver Arrested - Punekar News
summary:
Doctor Dies In Horrific Road Accident In Undri; Truck Driver Arrested

Date: 8th January 2025 Source: Punekar News

The incident involved Dr. Pranali Tanmay Date, a 34-year-old female doctor, who was killed by a speeding truck in Undri, Pune. The accident raised concerns among local residents about road safety.

  • Dr. Date was on her two-wheeler when she was hit by a truck around 12:30 pm.
  • The truck driver sped away but was arrested later after CCTV footage was reviewed.
  • Residents are alarmed by the frequency of accidents and have called the area a “death trap.”
  • Citizens are demanding better traffic control and safety measures to prevent future incidents.
“We have started keeping necessary medical supplies to treat at least one person every day.” - Local resident

This tragic event has led to a call for immediate actions from authorities to improve traffic safety in the Undri area.
newTitle: Tragic Road Accident Claims Life of Pune Doctor in Undri

title: 6 dead in stampede at Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati Temple; CM Naidu holds high-level meet - The Times of India
summary:
6 dead in stampede at Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati Temple; CM Naidu holds high-level meet

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Not provided

A tragic stampede at Tirupati Temple in Andhra Pradesh resulted in the deaths of six individuals, prompting Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to convene a high-level meeting to investigate the incident.

  • The stampede occurred during a large gathering, causing chaos and panic.
  • Emergency services were dispatched to the scene to aid the victims.
  • CM Naidu expressed condolences and announced compensation for the victims' families.
  • Authorities are reviewing safety measures at the temple to prevent future incidents.
“We must ensure the safety of all devotees,” said CM Naidu.

This incident raises concerns about crowd management at religious sites, highlighting the need for improved safety protocols.
newTitle: 6 dead in stampede at Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati Temple; CM Naidu holds high-level meet

title: 3 Die In Stampede At Tirupati During Distribution Of Tokens To Offer Prayers - NDTV
summary:
3 Die In Stampede At Tirupati During Distribution Of Tokens To Offer Prayers

Publication Date: January 8, 2025   Source: NDTV

Three individuals lost their lives in a tragic stampede that occurred during the distribution of Vaikunthadwara Sarvadarshanam tokens at Vishnu Niwasam in Tirupati. The incident happened due to a massive rush of devotees.

  • Three deaths reported during the stampede.
  • Four additional injuries were documented, with victims taken to Ruia Hospital.
  • Heavy police presence at the scene for crowd management.
  • Devotees were attempting to secure tokens to offer prayers.
“A massive rush of devotees attempting to secure tokens resulted in the stampede.”

This tragic incident highlights the critical need for improved crowd management at large religious gatherings.
newTitle: Tragic Stampede in Tirupati Claims Three Lives During Token Distribution

title: UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected, Check Toppers List - News18
summary:
UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected

Date: January 08, 2025

Source: News18

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the CDS I final merit list for 2024. A total of 590 candidates have been shortlisted for the Combined Defence Services, with 470 selected for the men’s course and 120 for the women’s course.

  • A total of 590 candidates selected.
  • Top three male candidates: Ranbir Negi, Archit Chauhan, Devendra Sharma.
  • Top three female candidates: Divya, Pranjal Nangare, Mansi Basera.
  • Results available on upsc.gov.in.
  • Verification of DOB and educational qualifications will be conducted by Army Headquarters.
“The candidature of all the candidates is Provisional.” - UPSC

The release of the merit list marks a crucial step for candidates aspiring to join the Indian Armed Forces through the CDS examination.
newTitle: UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected

title: SpaDeX satellites drift apart, docking pushed for 2nd time - The Times of India
summary:
SpaDeX Satellites Drift Apart, Docking Delayed Again

Publication Date: [Date unavailable] Source: [Source unavailable]

The SpaDeX satellites have drifted apart, causing their docking procedure to be postponed for the second time. This development raises concerns about the capabilities of the satellite systems.

  • The docking procedure was initially scheduled but has faced delays.
  • Scientists are investigating the reasons for the drift.
  • This could have implications for future space missions and operations.
"This is a setback for our planned operations in space." - [Quote unavailable]

This situation underscores the technical challenges associated with satellite operations, particularly in maintaining synchronization for docking.
newTitle: SpaDeX Satellites Drift Apart, Docking Delayed Again

title: ISRO's Experiment To Dock 2 Satellites In Space Postponed For 2nd Time - NDTV
summary:
ISRO's Experiment To Dock 2 Satellites In Space Postponed For 2nd Time

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has postponed its space docking experiment of satellites for the second time due to excessive drift observed between the mission satellites.

  • The mission was scheduled for Tuesday but was postponed to Thursday.
  • ISRO explained that the drift observed was higher than expected after a non-visibility period.
  • The Space Docking Experiment (SpaDeX) aims to develop critical docking technology for future missions.
  • Two satellites, a chaser and a target, will perform various maneuvers to achieve docking.
  • The operation is a significant step in enhancing India's capabilities in complex space operations.
S. Somanth, ISRO Chief: "They will do the docking exercise only when all sensors have been fully calibrated and tested to satisfaction before it is attempted."

This delay highlights the complexities involved in satellite docking, a process mastered by only a few nations.
newTitle: ISRO's Satellite Docking Experiment Delayed Again

title: Naresh Balyan facilitator in organised crime syndicate: Delhi police to court - Hindustan Times
summary:
Naresh Balyan facilitator in organised crime syndicate: Delhi police to court

Date: Jan 08, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi police have objected to the bail plea of MLA Naresh Balyan, alleging his involvement as a facilitator in an organized crime syndicate under the Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA).

  • Balyan is accused of being a facilitator in Kapil Sangwan's organized crime syndicate.
  • Police claim he provided financial assistance to a syndicate member to evade arrest.
  • There are 16 FIRs against the syndicate for various crimes.
  • Concerns were raised about potential witness tampering and destruction of evidence if bail is granted.
  • The court hearing concerning his bail application resumes on January 9.
"They have confessed that accused Naresh Balyan is facilitator/conspirator in the organised crime syndicate..." - Akhand Pratap Singh, Special Public Prosecutor

The accusations against Balyan highlight serious concerns regarding the influence of individuals involved in organized crime within the political framework.
newTitle: Delhi Police Opposes Bail for Naresh Balyan Linked to Organized Crime

title: Hyderabad set to experience coldest winter night in Jan, says weatherman - The Siasat Daily
summary:
Hyderabad Expected to Experience Coldest Winter Night This January

Date: January 8, 2025

Source: Telangana Weatherman

Hyderabad is bracing for its coldest winter night this January, with temperatures dropping to between 5-7 degrees Celsius in parts of North and West Telangana, and 7-9 degrees Celsius in some areas of Hyderabad.

  • The cold snap is expected to result in the chilliest morning of the month.
  • Misty or hazy conditions are forecasted in all zones of Hyderabad.
  • Health experts advise precautions, especially for vulnerable groups such as the elderly and children.
  • Risks include frostbite, trench foot, and hypothermia due to low temperatures.
“Tonight will be the coldest night of this January and get ready for the coldest morning tomorrow with temp up to 5-7°C in North, West TG and 7-9°C in few parts of Hyderabad.” — Telangana Weatherman (@balaji25_t)

Residents are urged to take necessary precautions to protect against the cold and potential health risks.
newTitle: Hyderabad Expected to Experience Coldest Winter Night This January

title: Ashok Gehlot's attack on AAP prompts Arvind Kejriwal's 'Congress-BJP together' charge - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ashok Gehlot's Attack on AAP Leads to Kejriwal's Accusation of Congress-BJP Alliance

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot labeled the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) as the Congress's primary opposition in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, prompting AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal to suggest a secret alliance between the Congress and BJP.

  • Gehlot stated that AAP is mistaken to believe they are the dominant party in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal accused Congress of working alongside BJP against AAP.
  • Gehlot defended Congress's campaign efforts and emphasized a shift in voting dynamics.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, 2025, with results due on February 8.
"They (the AAP) are our opposition...The situation in Delhi has changed now." - Ashok Gehlot

In conclusion, Gehlot's comments intensify the political landscape ahead of the crucial elections, highlighting the contentious relationships among the major parties in Delhi.
newTitle: Ashok Gehlot's Attack on AAP Leads to Kejriwal's Accusation of Congress-BJP Alliance

title: 'One of the greatest men…': British journalist pens moving tribute to Manmohan Singh - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘One of the greatest men…’: British journalist pens moving tribute to Manmohan Singh

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Financial Times

British journalist Martin Wolf honored former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh with a touching tribute, highlighting his legacy as a pivotal leader and policymaker.

  • Wolf described Singh as one of the most important policymakers of our era.
  • Singh served as India's Prime Minister until his passing at the age of 92 in December 2024.
  • The tribute praised Singh's integrity, stating he remained untainted by political corruption.
  • Wolf mentioned significant achievements during Singh's tenure, including the US nuclear deal and India's Aadhaar system.
  • Referencing Barack Obama, Wolf noted, “When the prime minister speaks, the world listens.”
  • The tribute emphasized Singh's belief in India's democracy and public service.
“Singh took ideas seriously, yet was unfailingly courteous and open to the ideas of others.” - Martin Wolf

This heartfelt tribute reflects on the indelible mark Manmohan Singh left on India and the global community.
newTitle: Martin Wolf's Heartfelt Tribute to Manmohan Singh

title: 52-Kg Suitcase Sparks Interest As MPs Weigh In On 'One Nation, One Election' At First JPC Meet - News18
Will Schools Remain Closed Tomorrow in Hubballi-Dharwad? Here’s All You Need to Know - Hubballi Times
summary:
Will Schools Remain Closed Tomorrow in Hubballi-Dharwad? Here’s All You Need to Know

Date: January 08, 2024 Source: Hubballi Times

The Dr. B. R. Ambedkar Fans Forum intends to hold a bandh on January 9, prompting local schools in Hubballi and Dharwad to close for safety reasons. The holiday will be compensated with full classes on the following Saturdays.

  • The Deputy Director of Public Instruction has mandated a holiday for schools within the city limits of Hubballi and Dharwad.
  • Schools in rural areas will remain open as usual.
  • Protesters are calling for all businesses to close in solidarity with the bandh.
  • Essential services like healthcare and transport will continue to operate despite potential disruptions.
“The safety of children is our priority,” said a spokesperson from the Deputy Director of Public Instruction.

This decision reflects the ongoing societal considerations surrounding public safety amid protests.
newTitle: Will Schools Remain Closed Tomorrow in Hubballi-Dharwad? Here’s All You Need to Know

title: Frame Cashless Treatment Scheme For Road Accident Victims During 'Golden Hour' By March 14 : Supreme Court Directs Centre - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Directs Cashless Treatment Scheme for Accident Victims by March 14, 2025

Date: January 8, 2025 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court of India has mandated the Central Government to create a scheme for cashless treatment for motor vehicle accident victims within the critical first hour of injury, referred to as the 'golden hour', by March 14, 2025. This initiative aims to save lives by ensuring immediate medical care.

  • The Court emphasized the urgency in implementing the scheme which has been a statutory obligation since the Motor Vehicles Act was updated.
  • Concerns were raised about existing delays in medical treatment due to payment issues and police delays.
  • Section 162 of the Motor Vehicles Act mandates a cashless treatment scheme, yet no scheme has been established despite this legal requirement.
  • Issues surrounding the draft concept note submitted by the Central Government were highlighted, particularly limitations on treatment amounts and coverage duration.
  • The Court ordered the creation of a Motor Vehicle Accident Fund to provide financial support for treatment costs.
“Once the scheme is framed and its implementation starts, it will save the lives of several injured persons...” - Supreme Court

Additionally, the Court reviewed the hit-and-run compensation scheme and noted the low claim rates despite the frequency of such accidents. They have directed improvements to expedite claims processing.

The Court's order aims to solidify the legal framework surrounding accident victim treatment and compensation, enhancing road safety and emergency care in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court Directs Cashless Treatment Scheme for Accident Victims by March 14, 2025

title: Google Maps lands Assam Police in Nagaland, locals hold them captive mistaking them for criminals - Deccan Herald
Boby Chemmanur arrested, Honey Rose's statement recorded - Onmanorama
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Arrested Following Honey Rose's Complaint

Published: January 08, 2025 07:45 PM IST

Updated: January 08, 2025 07:55 PM IST

Businessman Boby Chemmanur was arrested following actor Honey Rose's complaint of sexual harassment. Police confirmed his custody at the Ernakulam Central Police Station.

  • Boby Chemmanur arrested after allegations of sexual harassment by Honey Rose.
  • Honey Rose's statement was recorded by the Judicial Magistrate for over two hours.
  • Complaints detail incidents from a jewellery inauguration and public forums.
  • Around 20 YouTube channels are also facing complaints from Rose for defamatory content.
  • Chemmanur faces charges under IPC Section 75 and Section 67 of the IT Act.
“The specifics of Honey Rose's statement remain undisclosed but are critical for further charges.”

The investigation continues, with potential for additional charges against Chemmanur based on the findings regarding the allegations.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Arrested Following Honey Rose's Complaint

title: India’s foreign secretary meets Taliban minister for first time in Dubai - Hindustan Times
summary:
India’s foreign secretary meets Taliban minister for first time in Dubai

Date: January 8, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India has pledged support for Afghanistan in the health sector and for refugee rehabilitation during a significant meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban’s Acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi in Dubai.

  • First official meeting between an Indian Foreign Secretary and a senior Taliban official.
  • India to provide material support to healthcare and refugee rehabilitation following a request from the Taliban.
  • Discussion included promoting Chabahar port for humanitarian assistance to Afghanistan.
  • India highlighted its historic friendship and commitment to the Afghan people.
“The Afghan side underlined its sensitivities to India’s security concerns.”

In conclusion, this meeting marks a pivotal step in India's engagement with the Taliban regime, opening pathways for humanitarian assistance while emphasizing security concerns.
newTitle: India's Foreign Secretary Engages with Taliban Minister for Humanitarian Support

title: PM Modi holds roadshow, unveils projects worth 2 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam - Hindustan Times
PM Modi holds roadshow, unveils projects worth ₹2 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam - Hindustan Times
Sexual harassment: Police record arrest of Boby Chemmanur; Honey Rose gives confidential statement - Mathrubhumi English
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Arrested in Sexual Harassment Case Filed by Honey Rose

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Mathrubhumi

The Ernakulam Central Police arrested businessman Boby Chemmanur following allegations of sexual harassment made by actress Honey Rose. Chemmanur will be presented in court on Thursday.

  • Honey Rose recorded her statement at the Ernakulam First Class Magistrate Court.
  • A Special Investigation Team has been formed to investigate the allegations against Chemmanur.
  • The case has been registered under non-bailable sections of the law.
  • Honey Rose initially revealed the harassment on social media, naming Chemmanur later on.
  • Chemmanur denies all allegations and claims his interactions with Rose were friendly.
“I will take the same action against your supporters who share the same mentality,” - Honey Rose.

The investigation is ongoing, with police working to prevent Chemmanur from obtaining bail.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Arrested in Sexual Harassment Case Filed by Honey Rose

title: NLU grads, affluent persons keen to join judicial service: Supreme Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Notes Rising Interest in Judicial Careers Among NLU Graduates and Affluent Individuals

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 1:40 pm

The Supreme Court highlighted a growing demand for judicial service as a career, indicating that many graduates from National Law Universities (NLUs) are choosing to join the judiciary. The remarks were made during a plea concerning improvements in the service conditions of judges.

  • The Supreme Court noted an increase in NLU graduates entering the judiciary.
  • Justice Gavai commented on the interest of affluent individuals in judicial roles, linking it to the independence of the judiciary.
  • The Court raised concerns about inadequate pensions for district judges.
  • The matter was adjourned to February 21 for further hearings.
“Most NLU graduates immediately join the judiciary after graduation. People of affluent class today also want to join the judiciary. That has got something to do with the independence of the judiciary.” - Justice Gavai

The Supreme Court's observations underscore a significant trend in the judiciary's appeal among young legal professionals and the affluent, alongside ongoing discussions about judicial pay and benefits.
newTitle: Supreme Court Notes Rising Interest in Judicial Careers Among NLU Graduates and Affluent Individuals

title: One Nation, One Election meet: Opposition MPs question simultaneous polls, BJP members defend - Hindustan Times
summary:
One Nation, One Election meet: Opposition MPs question simultaneous polls, BJP members defend

Date: January 8, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The first meeting of the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on ‘One Nation, One Election’ bills featured a debate between opposition members and BJP MPs regarding the implications of simultaneous elections.

  • The JPC discussed the Constitution (129th Amendment) Bill and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill.
  • Opposition MPs, including Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, questioned the claim that simultaneous polls will reduce expenditure.
  • BJP members defended the bills, citing past instances of simultaneous polls and claiming public support for the idea.
  • Several opposition parties alleged that the proposed laws threaten federalism and undermine regional representation.
  • Concerns were raised about the impact on local issues and the engagement of elected representatives with their constituents.
“Upholding people's democratic rights is more important than saving money.” - TMC MP

The meeting highlighted significant divisions between government and opposition views on electoral reform and its effects on democratic processes in India.
newTitle: Opposition Questions Simultaneous Elections in Parliamentary Committee Meeting

title: Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai - News18
summary:
Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai

Date: January 09, 2025
Source: News18

Indian foreign secretary Vikram Misri met Taliban Defence Minister Muttaqi in Dubai on Wednesday, marking one of the first high-level meetings between New Delhi and the Taliban government in Afghanistan.

  • Discussion on India’s ongoing humanitarian assistance to Afghanistan.
  • Topics included bilateral issues and regional security situation.
  • India plans to promote trade and commerce, including through Chabahar port.
  • Support for health sector and rehabilitation of refugees discussed.
  • Cricket cooperation highlighted as popular among Afghan youth.
“India reiterated its commitment to continue to provide humanitarian & development assistance to the Afghan people.” – Randhir Jaiswal

This meeting comes amidst ongoing concerns about women's rights and the situation in Afghanistan, with India still considering whether to officially recognize the Taliban government.
newTitle: Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai

title: ‘Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4’: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief - News18
summary:
Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: News18

Rocket Scientist Dr V Narayanan has been appointed as the new chief of ISRO, expressing his commitment to improve the lives of Indians through technology and scientific advancements.

  • Dr V Narayanan considers his new role a great responsibility.
  • He has a clear plan for upcoming missions including Chandrayaan-4 and Gaganyan.
  • Dr Narayanan aims for advancements in climate studies, disaster management, communication, and earth observation.
  • His family expresses immense pride in his new position and contributions.
“Basically, the country needs a lot of things in terms of climate studies, disaster management system, communication requirements, satellites for communication, and earth observation.” – Dr V Narayanan

This appointment marks a hopeful new chapter for India's space aspirations as Dr Narayanan strives to enhance technology for societal benefit.
newTitle: Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

'Time He Lost Can't Be Restored' : Supreme Court Frees Prisoner After 25 Years, Finds He Was A Minor At The Time Of Offence - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Time He Lost Can't Be Restored: Supreme Court Frees Prisoner After 25 Years

Date: January 8, 2023 | Source: LiveLaw

In a landmark judgment, the Supreme Court ordered the release of Om Prakash, a prisoner convicted as an adult for murder, who was found to have been only 14 years old at the time of the offence in 1994.

  • The appellant was initially sentenced to death but had his sentence commuted to life imprisonment.
  • The Supreme Court acknowledged that previous judicial decisions had ignored important evidence regarding his age.
  • The Court criticized the handling of his plea of juvenility at all judicial levels.
  • It highlighted the injustices suffered by the appellant and the lengthy period of incarceration due to judicial errors.
“The time which he has lost, for no fault of his, can never be restored.”

The Supreme Court emphasized the need for his rehabilitation and integration into society following his release, directing the Uttarakhand State Legal Services Authority to assist him.
newTitle: Supreme Court Frees Prisoner After 25 Years, Finds He Was A Minor
